alert.note: Alert for Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Eastern Hanover; Eastern Henrico; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Northampton; Western Chesterfield; Western Hanover; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond); Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 26 at 4:39PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Virginia, east central Virginia, eastern Virginia, south central Virginia and southeast Virginia, including the following areas, in central Virginia, Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights), Eastern Hanover, Eastern Henrico, Western Chesterfield, Western Hanover and Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond). In east central Virginia, Charles City, Eastern Essex, Eastern King William, Eastern King and Queen, New Kent, Richmond, Western Essex, Western King William, Western King and Queen and Westmoreland. In eastern Virginia, Gloucester, Lancaster, Mathews, Middlesex, Northampton and Northumberland. In south central Virginia, Prince George. In southeast Virginia, Accomack, Chesapeake, Hampton/Poquoson, Isle of Wight, James City, Newport News, Norfolk/Portsmouth, Southampton, Suffolk, Surry, Sussex, Virginia Beach and York. * WHEN...Until 2 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and thunderstorms are expected to move into our area later this afternoon into this evening. Many areas in the watch area have already received numerous rounds of rainfall over the past several days. High resolution model guidance depicts that another 1 to 2 inches is possible in showers and thunderstorms today with isolated higher amounts also possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
